channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: E-scooter on footpath, 11th August
item.description:
Scooter left on footpath linking Noverton Avenue and Desert Orchid Road. This path is used by a local with a mobility scooter. Surely from the amount of times these scooters are being left in this vicinity it should be possible to trace the users and fine them or block them from using the scooters. I’m sure if it was my car left on a pavement I wouldn’t get away with it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Piccadilly Way, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three dog faeces, 10th August
item.description:
Yet again, disgusting people walking around Hucclecote with a dog did not tidy up their dog’s faeces. It’s on public land which children use and parents push pushchairs along. If people can’t tidy up after their pets, they shouldn’t have them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pinemount Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches have overtaken telephone cables risking breakage, 10th August
item.description:
Subject: Tree Branches Interfering with Telephone Cables on brookway drive gl538aj, Cheltenham I am writing to report a concern on brookway drive Cheltenham. One of the roadside trees has grown to a height where its branches are in direct contact with the overhead telephone cables. In high winds, the foliage catches on the cables, posing a risk that they could be damaged or brought down. Location: nearest house: Chelt house gl538aj, nearest street lamp number: 1 on brookway drive gl538aj Given the potential danger to communication services, I would be grateful if you could arrange for the branches to be pruned back so they no longer interfere with the cables. Please let me know if you require photographs or further details. I have reported this to open reach with reference number Marc donohoe 31 brookway drive Gl538aj 07738 106 842

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Brookway Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The hedge is overgrown, 10th August
item.description:
Subject: Overgrown Hedge on Winterbottom Road – Safety Hazard Dear Sir or Madam, I am a resident of Winterbottom Road in Cheltenham. I would like to report a serious safety issue caused by an overgrown hedge belonging to Pate’s Grammar School, located along the road. The hedge is very overgrown and extends significantly into the road. It has not been trimmed for a long time and no regular maintenance seems to be carried out. This creates several problems: Two vehicles cannot pass each other safely in this section. Drivers often have to be extremely cautious to avoid damage to their vehicles. Wing mirrors are being scratched or hit by the hedge branches. The situation is dangerous for both drivers and pedestrians, and it significantly reduces road safety. I kindly request that the hedge be trimmed back urgently and that regular maintenance be carried out in the future to prevent it from growing onto the road again. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Kind regards, Krystian Grzegorzewski Resident of Winterbottom Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Winterbotham Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Racist graffiti on road sign, 10th August
item.description:
Road sign on the bend in the road heading towards the entrance to Charlton Park on Moorend from the junction with Cirencester Road. As you can see from the photo, this needs to be removed immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The entire upper part of Melville Rd., 10th August
item.description:
The entire upper part of Melville Rd. When will the privately owned section of Melville Rd be resurfaced, just like the bottom, part council owned section and Winston Rd leading up to it?? It’s a an absolute disgrace, that the two roads that ere in some way linked to the council have been done and yet our section is left, it’s an awful stretch of road, which will effect house values and do if it’s not resurfaced by the end of the year, I’ll start legal proceedings for detrimental impact as well as start a petition which will involve as many houses on this stretch of Melville Rd withholding their council tax. Please just get it done, it’s a disgrace and does suggest a degree of nepotism! Thank you!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melville Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
